tuv.seg: If you are arrested and charged with an offence, you will be brought before a District Court as soon as possible
Má dhéantar duine a ghabháil agus a chúisiú le coir, tabharfar ós comhair na Cúirte Dúiche é/í chomh luath agus is féidir
You may make an application in court to be released from custody on bail
Is féidir iarratas a chur ós comhair na cúirte go scaoilfí an duine amach ar bhannaí
Bail is when you are released from custody because of a bond or promise made either by you or by another person (a surety) to guarantee that you will appear in court for your trial
Scaoiltear duine ar bhannaí mar gheall ar bhanna nó geallúint a dhéanann sé/sí féin nó duine eile (urra) le cinntiú go mbeidh an duine atá cúisithe i láthair le dul ós comhair na cúirte dá t(h)riail
Bail is based on the principle that the accused is presumed innocent until proved guilty
Glactar leis go bhfuil duine neamhciontach go dtí go bhfuil sé cruthaithe go bhfuil sé/sí ciontach agus is ar an mbunús sin a scaoiltear duine ar bhannaí
If you enter into a bail bond, you are committing yourself to appear in court to answer the charges made against you
Má théann duine faoi bhannaí tá sé/sí ag glacadh leis go dtiocfaidh sé/sí ós comhair na cúirte leis na cúiseanna atá curtha ina leith a fhreagairt
If you are sent for trial in the Special Criminal Court you cannot get bail unless the Director of Public Prosecutions directs otherwise
Má chuirtear ar aghaidh thú chun trialach sa Chúirt Choiriúil Speisialta, ní féidir leat bannaí a fháil mura n-ordaíonn an Stiúrthóir Ionchúiseamh Poiblí a mhalairt
The court may not be satisfied with your promise that you will appear in court to answer the charges made against you
D'fhéadfadh sé go mbeidh an chúirt sásta le geallúint ón té atá cúisithe go mbeidh sé/sí i láthair sa chúirt leis na cúiseanna atá curtha ina c(h)oinne a fhreagairt
The court may decide that an "independent surety" is required to guarantee your appearance
D'fhéadfadh sé go ndéanfaidh an chúirt cinneadh go bhfuil "urra neamhspléach" ag teastáil le cinntiú go mbeidh an duine i láthair
An independent surety is a person who makes him or herself responsible for your appearance in court
Duine a ghlacann freagracht air/uirthi féin go mbeidh an té atá cúisithe i láthair sa chúirt é/í urra neamhspléach
He or she promises to pay a sum of money to the court if you do not appear as agreed
Geallann sé/sí suim airgid a íoc leis an gcúirt muna dtagann an té atá cúisithe ós a comhair
When a Garda brings you into custody to a Garda station, the station may release you on bail either with or without sureties
Nuair a thugann Garda isteach i Stáisiún na nGardaí duine faoi choimeád, is féidir leis an stáisiún an duine sin a scaoileadh ar bhannaí le nó gan urraí
The amount of money specified in the bail bond is set by the Garda in charge of the station
Is é/í an Garda atá i gceannas an stáisiúin a dhéanann cinneadh cé mhéid airgid a bheidh i gceist leis an mbanna
You must enter into a bond to appear before the District Court on a specific date
Ní mór don té atá cúisithe geallúint a thabhairt a bheith i láthair ag an gCúirt Dúiche ar dáta faoi leith
When you are brought before the District Court, the judge may either remand you in custody or release you conditionally when you enter into a bail bond with or without surety
Nuair a thagann duine ós comhair na Cúirte Dúiche is féidir leis an mBreitheamh é/í a choinneáil faoi choimeád nó a scaoileadh ar choinníollacha bannaí le nó gan urra
The amount of money specified in the bail bond is set by the judge
Is é/í an breitheamh a dhéanann an cinneadh cé mhéid airgid a bheidh i gceist leis an mbanna
If you are granted bail you (or your surety) must pay into court at least one-third of the amount of money promised in the bail bond
Má thugtar cead do dhuine dul ar bhannaí ní mór dó/dí (nó a (h)urra) ar a laghad aon thrian den mhéid airgid atá geallta sa bhanna a íoc
This money will be returned to you if you appear in court as promised
Aisíocfar an t-airgead má thagann an té atá cúisithe ós comhair na cúirte mar a gheall sé/sí
The Director of Public Prosecutions can appeal the decision to grant you bail or the conditions of your bail to the High Court
Féadfaidh an Stiúrthóir Ionchúiseamh Poiblí an cinneadh a achomharc chun bannaí a dheonú duit nó coinníollacha do bhannaí a achomharc leis an Ard-Chúirt
If the District Court refuses bail, you will be remanded in custody
Má dhiúltaíonn an Chúirt Dúiche duine a scaoileadh ar bhannaí coinneofar siar faoi choimeád an duine sin
You can appeal the decision to the High Court
Is féidir le duine achomharc faoin gcinneadh sin a chur ós comhair na hArdchúirte
If you are charged with treason, war crimes, murder, attempt to murder, conspiracy to murder or piracy and genocide, the District Court does not have the power to grant you bail

Má chuirtear cúiseanna a bhaineann le tréas, coireanna cogaidh, dúnmharú, iarracht duine a dhúnmharú, comhcheilg le dúnmharú nó píoráideacht agus cinedhíothú, i leith duine níl sé de chumhacht ag an gCúirt Dúiche an duine sin a scaoileadh ar bhannaí
Certain offences under the Offences Against the State Act, 1939 and the Official Secrets Act, 1963 also rule out the granting of bail in the District Court
Níl cead ag an gCúirt Dúiche ach an oiread duine atá cúisithe le coireanna faoi leith a bhaineann leis an Acht um Chiontuithe in Aghaidh an Stáit 1939 agus leis an Acht um Rúndachta Oifigiúil 1963
In those cases, you or your legal representative must apply to the High Court for bail
Sna cásanna sin, ní mór don té atá cúisithe nó dá (h)ionadaí dlí iarratas a chur ós comhair na hArdcúirte ar bhannaí
Considerations of the Court
Rudaí nach mór don Chúirt a chur san áireamh
Whether or not the District Court will grant you bail depends on a number of factors;
Tá roinnt rudaí ar a mbunófaidh an Chúirt Dúiche an cinneadh duine a scaoileadh ar bhannaí nó bannaí a dhiúltú:
• Whether you are likely to flee
• An bhfuil cosúlacht ann go n-éalóidh an duine
• If you are charged with a serious offence, whether you are likely to commit a serious offence while on bail
• Más coir throm atá curtha i leith an duine an bhfuil cosúlacht ann go ndéanfaidh sé/sí coir throm eile agus é/í saor ar bhannaí
A serious offence is one for which you may be punished by a term of 5 years imprisonment
Is coir throm aon choir lena mbaineann téarma sa phríosún de 5 bhliain
• The fact that you were caught red-handed
• Má rugadh ar an duine atá cúisithe agus é/í i mbun na coire
• Whether you are likely to interfere with evidence, witnesses or jurors
• An bhfuil seans ann go gcuirfidh an duine isteach ar fhianaise, ar fhinnéithe nó ar bhaill den ghiúiré
• Whether you have ever breached a bail bond before
• Ar sháraigh an duine téarmaí bannaí cheana
• Your character and previous criminal record
• Cén sórt duine atá i gceist agus an bhfuil stair coireanna aige/aici
• Your circumstances (whether you have a family, a job, a house, etc.)
• A s(h)aol pearsanta (an bhfuil clann, post agus teach, & rl ag an duine)
• Whether you have roots in this jurisdiction - i.e., property, family, employment
• An bhfuil ceangal ag an duine leis an Stát seo - i.e., áitreabh, clann, fostaíocht
• Whether you are willing to keep to certain conditions (e.g., surrendering your passport)
• An bhfuil an duine sásta aontú le coinníollacha faoi leith (e.g., a p(h)ás a thabhairt suas)
• The seriousness of the offence
• Cé chomh trom atá an choir atá curtha i leith an duine
• The likely sentence if you are convicted
• Cén bhreith gur dócha a bheadh ann dá mbeadh an duine ciontach
• The strength of the evidence against you
• Cé chomh láidir atá an fhianaise i gcoinne an duine
• Whether the Gardai object to you being granted bail
• An bhfuil na Gardaí i gcoinne an duine a scaoileadh ar bhannaí
People who cannot be accepted as sureties or bails-persons
Daoine nach féidir glacadh leo mar urraí ná mar dhaoine bannaí
A court cannot reject a person as a surety simply because of his/her moral character or political opinions
Ní féidir leis an gcúirt diúltú glacadh le duine mar urra bunaithe go simplí ar a d(h)rocháil morálta nó ar a c(h)laonadh polaitiúil
However, a surety may be rejected if it is clear that he or she could not pay the amount of money specified if the bail-bond was breached
Ach, is féidir diúltú glacadh le duine mar urra má tá sé soiléar nach mbeadh an duine sin in ann an suim airgid atá luaite leis an mbanna a íoc dá sárófaí coinníollacha na mbannaí
The following persons may not be accepted as bails-persons;
Ní féidir glacadh leis na daoine seo a leanas mar urraithe bhannaí:
• those under 18 years of age
• aon duine atá faoi 18 bliain d'aois
• those with previous convictions
• iad siúd a bhfuil cionta ina leith roimhe seo
• those recently declared bankrupt by Order of the Court
• iad siúd a dearbhaíodh go bhfuil siad ina bhféimheach le hOrdú na Cúirte
Where an application for bail is made by someone charged with a serious offence, a court may refuse the application
Má chuirtear cion tromchúiseach i leith duine féadfaidh cúirt diúltiú d'iarratas an té sin go ligfaí é nó í amach ar bhannaí
These grounds for refusal are set out in Section 2 of the Bail Act, 1997
Tá na fáthanna séanta seo leagtha síos i gCuid 2 den Acht um Bannaí, 1997
Grounds on which the courts may refuse the application are where it is considered necessary to prevent the person committing of a serious offence while on bail
Féadfaidh na cúirteanna iarratas a shéanadh má mheastar gur gá é chun duine a chosc ó chion a dhéanamh fad atá sé nó sí amuigh ar bhannaí
Items the court takes into account when making a decision to refuse bail are:
I measc na rudaí a chuireann an chúirt san áireamh agus cinneadh á dhéanamh aici bannaí a shéanadh tá:
• evidence or submissions concerning the nature and seriousness of the crime charged;
• Fianaise nó aighneacht faoin gcineál coire atá á chur i leith duine agus a thromchúisí is atá sí
• the severity of the punishment provided for by law for the offence;
• Géire an phianóis atá leagtha síos de réir an dlí don choir sin;
• the strength of the case against the accused;
• Treise an cháis in aghaidh an chúisí;
• the prospect of a reasonably speedy trial;
• An cosúlacht go mbeidh an triail ann gan ró-mhoill;
• the opposition of the Attorney General;
• An tArd-Aighne a bheith ina aghaidh;
• any previous convictions of the accused person including any conviction the subject of an appeal (which has neither been determined nor withdrawn) to a court; and
• Gur ciontaíodh an cúisí cheana féin, fiú má tá achomharc cúirte á dhéanamh aige nó aici faoin scéal is nach ndearnadh cinneadh faoi is nár tarraingíodh siar é; agus
• any other offence in respect of which the accused person is charged and is awaiting trial
• Aon chion eile atá curtha i leith an té atá cúisithe agus a bhfuil sé nó sí ag fanacht le triail dá bharr
Consequences of breaching a bail bond
Céard a tharlaíonn má sháraíonn duine na bannaí
• If you do not appear in court as agreed, a bench warrant will be issued for your arrest
• Má theipeann ar dhuine teacht i láthair na cúirte mar a bhí aontaithe, éiseófar barántas binse leis an duine sin a ghabháil
This means that the Gardai have been ordered to arrest you and bring you before the court
Beidh ordú tugtha do na Gardaí an duine a ghabháil agus a thabhairt ós comhair na cúirte
• The amount of money that was specified in the bail bond will be forfeited by you and/or your independent surety
• Íocfaidh tú an tsuim airgid a sonraíodh sa chúirtbhanna agus/nó do bhanna urra neamspleách
• You will have committed a further criminal offence that carries a maximum penalty of a Class A fine and/or 12 months imprisonment
• Beidh cion breise coiriúil déanta agat ar a ngearrtar pionós uasta fíneáil Aicme A agus/nó príosúnacht 12 mhí
This sentence is set down in Section 13 of the Criminal Justice Act, 1984 as amended
Tá an phianbhreith seo leagtha síos in Alt 13 den Acht um Cheartas Coiriúil, 1984 arna leasú
• You will be refused bail in the future
• Diúltófar bannaí a thabhairt duit amach anseo
You can show you had a reasonable cause for not appearing on the date
Féadfaidh tú a thaispeáint go raibh cúis réasúnta agat gan teacht i láthair ar an dáta
Possible circumstances might include an illness, family emergency, or a family death
I measc na gcúinsí féideartha, d’fhéadfadh an méid a leanas a bheith i gceist: breoiteacht, éigeandáil teaghlaigh, nó bás duine mhuinteartha
It remains, however, at the discretion of the court as to whether or not any such excuse is accepted
Tá sé faoi lánrogha na cúirte, áfach, i gcónaí maidir le cibé acu an bhfuil an leithscéal sin inghlactha nó nach bhfuil
After you are arrested and brought to a Garda station, the member in charge of the station may decide to release you on station bail
Tar éis duine a ghabháil agus a thabhairt chuig Stáisiún na nGardaí d'fhéadfadh sé go ndéanfaidh an duine atá i gceannas an stáisiúin cinneadh é/í a shaorú ar bhannaí stáisiúin
He or she will grant bail if he or she "considers it prudent to do so"
Déanfaidh an Garda an cinneadh seo má cheapann sé/sí "gur cinneadh stuama" a bheadh ann
He or she does not have the power to release you on bail if there is a court warrant for your detention
Níl sé de chumhacht ag an nGarda duine a scaoileadh ar bhannaí a bhfuil barántas cúirte éisithe len é/í a ghabháil
If you are granted bail at the station, you will have to enter into a bond to appear in the District Court as agreed
Má scaoiltear duine ar bhannaí stáisiúin beidh air/uirthi dul faoi bhanna le teacht i láthair ag an gCúirt Dúiche mar a aontaíodh
You may have to pay a sum of money and you may also have to get an independent surety to guarantee that you will appear in court as agreed
D'fhéadfadh sé go mbeadh ar an té atá cúisithe suim airgid a íoc agus urra neamhspléach a fháil freisin le cinntiú go dtiocfaidh sé/sí ós comhair na cúirte mar a aontaíodh
If you are arrested and detained, you will be brought to the District Court as soon as possible
Má dhéantar duine a ghabháil agus a choinneáil, tabharfar ós comhair na Cúirte Dúiche é/í chomh luath agus is féidir
At the District Court, your legal representative may make a formal application to the judge that you be released on bail
Is féidir le hionadaí dlí an duine atá cúisithe iarratas foirmiúil a chur ós comhair an Bhreithimh é/í a scaoileadh ar bhannaí
Usually the most important issue that will be discussed during the application is whether you are likely to abscond and avoid your trial
Go hiondúil agus iarratas ar bhannaí dhá phlé leagfar béim ar an gceist an bhfuil cosúlacht ann go n-éalóidh an té atá cúisithe gan teacht i láthair dá t(h)riail
